snippet: The arrest of the engineer, Abdur Razzaque Khan, was a surprise twist since he was regarded as something of a hero for trying to avert the April 24 disaster.
abstract: Bangladeshi police arrest Abudur Razzaque Khan, engineer who warned that factory building in Savar was unsafe the day before its collapse; arrest comes as surprise given that Khan was regarded as hero for trying to avert disaster; police say building's owner Sohel Rana and factory owners are blaming Khan, saying he told them that cracks were only small problem.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK

lead_paragraph: The arrest of the engineer, Abdur Razzaque Khan, was a surprise twist since he was regarded as something of a hero for trying to avert the April 24 disaster.

headline.seo: Engineer Arrested in Bangladeshi Building Collapse
headline.main: Bangladesh Arrests Engineer Who Warned of Dangers
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Arrests Engineer Who Warned of Dangers
